depts.name: Finance
depts.description: The Department of Finance provides advanced education in asset pricing, corporate finance, and risk management. We combine theoretical rigor with practical application, utilizing modern financial tools and market data.

courses.title: Bachelor's in Accounting & Finance
courses.description: Solid foundation in accounting, finance, and management.

sections.title: Description
sections.content:
The Accounting & Finance BSc program at Sykli College provides a solid foundation in accounting, finance, and management. Students gain practical and theoretical knowledge in financial accounting, management accounting, corporate governance, auditing, performance management, and financial decision-making.

The program equips students with analytical skills and business understanding necessary for careers in accounting, finance, and corporate administration.

sections.title: Language of Instruction
sections.content:
English (all courses)

The program is designed to prepare students for careers in international business environments.

sections.title: Tuition Fees and Scholarships
sections.content:
Tuition Fee: Included in degree tuition for full-time BSc students
Scholarships:
  • Merit-based scholarships for high-achieving students
  • Need-based financial aid
  • Support for international students

Detailed scholarship information is available on the Sykli College Scholarships page.

sections.title: Structure of Studies
sections.content:
BSc in Accounting & Finance (3 Years):

Core Courses:
  • Introduction to Financial Accounting
  • Management Accounting I & II
  • Financial Statement Analysis
  • Corporate Governance
  • Auditing – Theory and Practice
  • Performance Management
Electives and Projects:
  • Big Data Analysis in Accounting
  • Risk Management and Financial Planning
  • Entrepreneurship Law
Final Year:
  • Students complete a capstone project or thesis to apply their knowledge in a practical accounting or finance scenario.

The program emphasizes hands-on exercises, case studies, and team-based projects.

sections.title: Specialisations
sections.content:
Students may focus on areas such as:

  • Financial Accounting and Reporting
  • Management Accounting and Planning
  • Auditing and Compliance
  • Risk Management and Sustainability Accounting

Specialisations help tailor the degree to the student’s career goals.

sections.title: Internationalisation
sections.content:
• Opportunities for student exchange with partner universities
  • International workshops, seminars, and guest lectures
  • Collaboration on global finance and accounting projects

International exposure prepares students for multinational corporations and global finance roles.

sections.title: Further Study Opportunities
sections.content:
Graduates can pursue:

  • MSc programs in Accounting, Finance, or Business Analytics
  • Professional certifications (CPA, ACCA, CFA)
  • Research positions or internships in accounting and finance firms

sections.title: Career Opportunities
sections.content:
Potential career paths include:

  • Accountant or Financial Analyst
  • Auditor or Compliance Officer
  • Management Consultant
  • Corporate Finance Specialist
  • Entrepreneur in Financial Services

sections.title: Research Focus
sections.content:
The Accounting & Finance Department emphasizes:

  • Corporate finance and management accounting
  • Auditing and regulatory compliance
  • Risk management and financial planning
  • Sustainability accounting
  • Accounting analytics and data-driven decision-making

sections.title: Co-operation with Other Parties
sections.content:
• Collaboration with leading accounting and finance firms
  • Partnerships with multinational companies for internships and projects
  • Engagement with regulatory authorities and professional bodies

sections.title: Study-Option-Specific Evaluation Criteria in Admissions
sections.content:
Applicants are evaluated based on:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Academic performance, especially in mathematics and business-related subjects
  • Motivation letter and career aspirations
  • Letters of recommendation
  • Relevant extracurricular or internship experience

sections.title: Contact Information
sections.content:
Sykli College School of Business – Accounting & Finance Department

Email: accounting@syklicollege.com

Address: Sykli College, Otaniemi Campus, Finland

Office Hours: Monday–Friday, 9:00–17:00

courses.title: Master's in Accounting & Finance
courses.description: Advanced knowledge in accounting, corporate finance, auditing, and financial management.
courses.entryRequirements: Bachelor's degree in Business or related field

sections.title: Description
sections.content:
The Accounting & Finance MSc program at Sykli College is designed for students seeking advanced knowledge in accounting, corporate finance, auditing, and financial management. The program emphasizes both theoretical understanding and practical application of accounting standards, corporate governance, strategic management accounting, performance management, risk management, and sustainability in accounting.

Students develop analytical skills for complex financial decision-making, preparing them for leadership roles in accounting, finance, and corporate strategy.

sections.title: Language of Instruction
sections.content:
English (all courses)

The program prepares students for careers in international business environments and global financial institutions.

sections.title: Tuition Fees and Scholarships
sections.content:
Tuition Fee: Included in degree tuition for full-time MSc students
Scholarships:
  • Merit-based scholarships for top-performing applicants
  • Need-based financial aid
  • Scholarships for international students

Detailed scholarship information and application procedures are available on the Sykli College Scholarships page.

sections.title: Structure of Studies
sections.content:
MSc in Accounting & Finance (2 Years):

Core Courses:
  • Financial Statement Analysis
  • Financial Accounting Theories
  • Corporate Governance
  • Strategic Management Accounting
  • Auditing – Theory and Practice
  • Performance Management
  • Accounting for Sustainability
Specialised Courses:
  • Risk Management: Organization and Control
  • Financial Management for Entrepreneurs
  • Capital Budgeting
  • Big Data Analysis in Accounting
  • Entrepreneurship Law in Practice
Capstone / Thesis:
  • Students complete an individual thesis project focusing on applied accounting and financial issues.

Practical exercises, case studies, and real-world financial scenarios are embedded throughout the program.

sections.title: Specialisations
sections.content:
Students may choose to focus on:

  • Corporate Finance and Auditing
  • Strategic and Management Accounting
  • Financial Risk and Sustainability
  • Accounting Analytics and Big Data Applications

Specialisations allow tailoring the degree to career ambitions in consulting, corporate finance, or regulatory roles.

sections.title: Internationalisation
sections.content:
• Student exchange opportunities with partner universities worldwide
  • Participation in international conferences and workshops
  • Guest lectures from global finance and accounting professionals

International exposure prepares graduates for multinational organizations and global business roles.

sections.title: Further Study Opportunities
sections.content:
Graduates of the MSc program can pursue:

  • Doctoral programs (PhD) in Accounting, Finance, or Management
  • Professional certifications: CPA, CFA, ACCA
  • Advanced research positions in universities or policy institutes

sections.title: Career Opportunities
sections.content:
Potential career paths include:

  • Financial Analyst or Advisor
  • Corporate Auditor or Compliance Officer
  • Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
  • Management Consultant
  • Entrepreneur in Finance and Accounting Services

sections.title: Research Focus
sections.content:
Sykli College Accounting & Finance Department focuses on:

  • Advanced corporate finance and valuation
  • Management accounting and strategic decision-making
  • Auditing and compliance research
  • Sustainability accounting and reporting
  • Big Data analytics in financial decision-making

sections.title: Co-operation with Other Parties
sections.content:
• Collaborations with international accounting firms and financial institutions
  • Partnerships with multinational corporations for research projects and internships
  • Engagement with regulatory bodies and policy institutes

sections.title: Study-Option-Specific Evaluation Criteria in Master's Admissions 2025
sections.content:
Applicants are evaluated based on:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or related field
  • Academic excellence (GPA or minimum grade requirement)
  • Motivation letter and career goals
  • Letters of recommendation
  • Relevant professional experience or internships

Additional criteria may apply for international students and scholarship applications.

sections.title: Contact Information
sections.content:
Sykli College School of Business – Accounting & Finance Department

Email: accounting@syklicollege.edu

Phone: +358 20 123 4568

Address: Sykli College, Otaniemi Campus, Finland

Office Hours: Monday–Friday, 9:00–17:00

courses.title: Bachelor's in Finance
courses.description: Foundational program in corporate finance, investments, financial markets, derivatives, fixed income, portfolio management, and personal finance.
courses.careerPaths: Financial Analyst; Investment Banker; Risk Manager;

sections.title: Programme Description
sections.content:
The Finance BACHELOR programme at Sykli College offers a comprehensive curriculum designed to prepare students for leadership roles in the global economy. The programme integrates theoretical foundations with practical applications, focusing on sustainable practices and innovative thinking.

Students will engage in multi-disciplinary projects, case studies, and corporate collaborations to develop the skills necessary for a successful career in Finance.

sections.title: Degree Structure
sections.content:
The degree consists of core studies, specialization courses, and a final thesis project. The curriculum is updated annually to reflect the latest industry trends and research insights.

  • Core Discipline Studies (150 ECTS)
  • Elective Studies (20 ECTS)
  • Bachelor's Thesis (30 ECTS)

sections.title: Career Opportunities
sections.content:
Graduates of the Finance programme are highly sought after by international organizations, consulting firms, and innovative startups. Potential career paths include:

  • Senior Finance Consultant
  • Project Lead in Finance Operations
  • Research & Development Specialist
  • Independent Entrepreneur in the Finance Sector

sections.title: Admissions Information
sections.content:
Admission is based on academic excellence and potential for impact. Applicants must demonstrate strong analytical skills and a commitment to sustainable business values.

Required documents include previous degree certificates, transcripts, a motivation letter, and proof of English proficiency.

courses.title: Master's in Finance
courses.description: Advanced corporate finance, derivatives, fixed income, portfolio management, mergers and acquisitions, advanced investments, and valuation.
courses.entryRequirements: Bachelor's degree in Finance or Economics

courses.title: Master's in Strategic Management & Finance
courses.description: A specialized program for strategic financial leadership. It integrates core management principles with advanced corporate finance, focusing on international strategy and brand valuation. Graduates are prepared for CFO and strategic leadership roles in large enterprises.
courses.entryRequirements: Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or Economics. High mathematical proficiency. Statement of purpose focused on strategic career goals. Two professional or academic references.

sections.title: Programme Description
sections.content:
